instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the mapping models and how far can this metric go in distinguishing cotton fields from other crop types with similar spectral behavior?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the mapping models was the overall accuracy. This metric measures the percentage of correctly classified pixels in relation to the total number of pixels. In the related study, the overall accuracy was found to be higher than 95% when field data were used for validation, and 93% when visual interpretation of NDVI temporal profiles were used for validation.

The overall accuracy metric can go a long way in distinguishing cotton fields from other crop types with similar spectral behavior. With an accuracy higher than 95%, the mapping models were able to accurately identify and separate cotton fields from other crops in the same period. This indicates that the models were successful in capturing the unique spectral behavior of cotton fields and differentiating them from other crops. The high accuracy achieved by the models suggests that they can reliably distinguish cotton fields from other crop types in the study area.
